Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the statement about the last statewide recount in Wisconsin in 2016.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the recount in 2016 did not change the outcome of the election in Wisconsin.
Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the impact of the recount by stating that the vote margin changed by only 131 votes out of 2.7 million votes cast.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim does not appear to falter at any point.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the 2016 recount is relevant and comparable to the current situation without providing any justification for this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no alternative explanation provided in the claim.
